laboratory_examinations.findings: Substantial mass located in the bladder and two small stones.
Lobulated tumor located in the bladder’s posterior wall with a size of approximately 3.5 × 2.4 × 2.1 cm; significant enhancement of the tumor was noted.

Tumor cells were epithelioid, spindle-shaped, with vacuoles in the nucleus; features included visible nucleolus, transparent nuclear membrane, karyolysis, focal necrosis, rich blood vessels, and interstitial inflammatory cell infiltration. Immunohistochemical results: positive for S100 (++), CD27 (++), CD1a (++), Ki67 (35%), CD68 (++), and CD163 (++); negative for several other markers.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: No tumor invasion of muscular bladder tissue detected.
